activities.description: Swim with and feed wild Southern Stingrays at a secluded sandbar in the North Sound of Grand Cayman. Stingray City is home to approximately 90 Southern Stingrays and is the number one tourist attraction in the Cayman Islands. Visitors can pet and interact with these docile creatures in waist-deep water.

providers.name: Captain Marvin's Watersports
providers.description: Operating since 1951, one of the oldest tour operators

providers.name: Red Sail Sports
providers.description: Tours include snorkeling over shallow coral reef and visits to Starfish Point, departing on catamaran with licensed cash bar

providers.name: White Sand Water Sports
providers.description: Small groups of maximum 17 people, runs trips during off-times when sandbar is less crowded

providers.name: Rowan Watersports
providers.description: Caymanian family-owned business, small group focus

price_range.notes: Varies by operator and whether tour includes multiple stops

location.travel_time: 30 minutes by boat from Seven Mile Beach

whats_included: Often includes stops at Coral Gardens and Starfish Point
Some operators include shuttle service from cruise port
tips: Try to go when cruise ships are not in port for less crowded experience
Sunrise trips (7am departure) offer best experience with fewer crowds
Stingrays are ready for their first meal early morning

activities.description: Explore Grand Cayman's National Marine Park aboard a 48-passenger submarine called Atlantis XI. Journey underwater in a real submarine specifically designed for underwater sightseeing excursions. During the 45-minute ride, reach depths of 100 feet (30 meters) while exploring coral canyons and marine life including sea sponges, snapper, grouper, sea turtles, and tropical fish.

price_range.notes: $44 for semi-submarine option, $114+ for full submarine expedition

location.address: Waterfront in Georgetown, across from Hard Rock Cafe

tour_options.name: Seaworld Observatory Semi-Submarine
tour_options.description: View shipwrecks Cali and Balboa, Cheeseburger Reef, watch diver feed fish without getting wet

tour_options.name: Night Dive
tour_options.description: Dramatic nighttime views of nocturnal creatures

activities.description: Dive or snorkel the ex-US Navy submarine rescue vessel USS Kittiwake, a 251-foot long, five-deck ship intentionally sunk in 2011 to create Grand Cayman's most accessible artificial reef. The wreck sits at maximum depth of 65 feet with highest point only 15 feet below surface. Attracts abundant marine life including schools of tropical fish, sea turtles, eagle rays, barracuda, groupers, and jacks.

providers.name: Deep Blue Divers
providers.description: Exclusive licensed dive operation for Kittiwake

providers.name: Cayman Turtle Divers
providers.description: Offers dives 7 days a week

price_range.notes: Marine Park fee included in dive operator charges

whats_included: Boat transportation (required - swimming from shore prohibited)

restrictions.access: Must use CITA licensed dive/snorkel operator
rules: No touching or removing anything within Marine Park

activities.notes: Open to all dive experience levels. Snorkelers can see stack at 30ft depth.

activities.description: Two of the most popular shore diving spots on Grand Cayman, featuring large reef formations with caverns and tunnels rising from 40-foot sand bottom to within feet of surface. Summer months feature large schools of Silversides with Tarpon swimming through. Accessible to beginner and intermediate divers and snorkelers.

providers.name: Eden Rock Diving Center
providers.description: Teaching diving since 1983, gateway to both sites

price_range.notes: $72 for 1-tank dive rental, $90 for 2-tank rental, $125-150 for guided 2-tank dive

tips: Time of day matters for best lighting - light beams from above
Follow sand channel out - left for Eden Rock, right for Devil's Grotto
Tunnels at about 40 feet end in 20 feet of water on shallow side

activities.description: Experience the magical glow of bioluminescent plankton (Dinoflagellates) in a man-made bay. Grand Cayman is one of only a few locations worldwide where you can witness this phenomenon. The glow is activated by movement, creating bright blue paint strokes following kayaks. Tours available by kayak or electric boat.

providers.name: Cayman Kayaks
providers.description: Original tour operator, family-run business. Won GOLD in Best of Cayman Islands Awards for Best Tourist Attraction and Best Watersports Company. Only electric custom bio boat tours in Cayman.
providers.departure_point: Rum Point, 46 Sand Point Drive, Northside

providers.name: George's Watersports
providers.description: Boat tour with snorkeling option (10x better visibility in water with mask)
providers.departure_point: Cayman Islands Yacht Club, near Seven Mile Beach

providers.name: Sweet Spot Watersports
providers.description: Cayman's first boat tour to Bio Bay. 3 stops: Starfish Point sunset, upside-down jellyfish, Bio Bay

price_range.notes: $135 adults, $110 kids under 12 at George's Watersports

location.boat_ride: 20 minutes from west side departure points

schedule.moon_cycle: Tours based around moon cycle - only on darkest nights of month

tips: Avoid hair products, lotions, bug repellents that can harm organisms
If staying near Rum Point, use Cayman Kayaks
If staying near Seven Mile Beach, George's Watersports is closer

activities.description: Aerial tours of the Cayman Islands' beautiful scenery from breathtaking heights. See Seven Mile Beach, Stingray City, coral reefs, and the entire island from above. Cayman Islands Helicopters operates a custom Eurocopter AS350 B2 featuring underwater life paint scheme designed by ocean conservationist Guy Harvey.

providers.name: Cayman Islands Helicopters
providers.description: Only helicopter operator on the island
providers.hours: Monday-Saturday 8am-sunset, closed Sundays and major holidays

providers.name: Shaggy's Diving (Helicopter Diving)
providers.description: Private helicopter diving tours to Sister Islands

tour_options.name: Stingray City Tour
tour_options.description: Most popular excursion, includes Kittiwake and Seven Mile Beach

tour_options.name: Island Tour
tour_options.description: Full coast tour around Grand Cayman

tour_options.name: Sunset Flight & Dinner
tour_options.description: Helicopter to Ritz Carlton or Camana Bay for dinner

tour_options.name: Fly, Dive and Dine
tour_options.description: All-day excursion including flight to Cayman Brac and Little Cayman for diving

tour_options.name: Private Helicopter Diving Tour
tour_options.description: 50-minute flight to Sister Islands, includes all equipment, DPVs, guided dives

whats_included: Free shuttle from George Town or Seven Mile Beach hotels

activities.description: Fun, family-friendly entertainment where you can get up close and personal with sea turtles. Swim with young turtles in the Turtle Lagoon, visit the hatchery and education centre, enjoy Breakers Lagoon freshwater pool with waterfall, and experience the Turtle Twister Waterslide. Also features Smiley's Croc Cove, Cayman Butterfly House, and historic Cayman Street.

price_range.notes: Island Wildlife Encounter pass. Resident rates require local picture ID.

location.transportation: Courtesy shuttle from Seven Mile Beach hotels, parking available

activities.description: Explore stunning underground crystal formations on guided tours through three caves. Learn about their formation and history while walking and climbing among literal hidden gems. The caves feature tropical forest wildlife above ground as well. Ranked as a top attraction worldwide.

location.area: North Side, near Old Man Bay

schedule.tours: On the hour from 9am to 4pm daily

activities.description: Guided walkthrough of a functioning distillery with informative talk about rum-making process from fermentation, distillation, aging and bottling. Includes full tasting of spirits produced on site including Seven Fathoms Rum (national rum of Cayman Islands and official rum of Cayman Airways), Gun Bay Vodka, and Governor's Reserve varieties. Ranked #1 Traveler attraction in Cayman Islands.

providers.name: Cayman Spirits Co.
providers.address: 68 Bronze Road, George Town, Grand Cayman

whats_included: Full tasting of approximately 15 different rums
products_featured: Governor's Reserve Rum (coconut, banana, spiced, dark)

booking.walk_ins: Accepted but may not be available

activities.private_events: Available for parties, corporate functions, dinners, custom tastings

activities.description: Zip across the dazzling azure Caribbean waters surrounded by stunning Seven Mile Beach scenery. Options include rentals and guided tours to popular stops like Stingray City, Starfish Point, and Rum Point.

providers.name: Red Sail Sports
providers.description: Over 35 years operating, Sea-doo Waverunners available at all Grand Cayman locations

providers.name: Sea Breeze Charters & Jet Ski Tours
providers.description: Premier charter service

providers.name: Cayman Watersports
providers.description: Private charters with complimentary jet ski

location.area: Seven Mile Beach and various locations

restrictions.adult_required_for_minors: Children 5-15 must be accompanied by adult 18+

activities.description: Soar above Seven Mile Beach and the Caribbean Sea for breathtaking aerial views. Experience the thrill of parasailing with stunning panoramic views of the coastline.

Explore Grand Cayman's crystal-clear waters at your own pace on kayaks or stand-up paddleboards. Options include single and double kayaks, standard paddleboards, see-through paddleboards for underwater viewing, and mega group boards.

providers.name: Paradise Paddle Cayman
features: Free delivery and pickup on Seven Mile Beach

providers.name: Adventura Cayman
features: Free delivery West Bay to South Sound

price_range.notes: Hourly rentals $25-40, extended rentals as low as $7/day

activities.description: World-class fishing just minutes from shore. The Cayman Trench drops to over 20,000 feet, creating ideal conditions for Marlin, Yellowfin Tuna, Mahi Mahi, Wahoo, and more. The drop-off is less than 10 minutes from dock, unlike other destinations requiring 1-2 hours to reach fishing grounds. Crew helps clean and fillet your catch.

Visit the birthplace of mudslide cocktails on Grand Cayman's northern tip. Tranquil beach escape with calm shallow turquoise waters, white sandy beach, hammocks, shady trees, and island atmosphere. Ideal spot for swimming, snorkeling, and relaxation away from the busier Seven Mile Beach.

price_range.notes: Beach access is free; costs for food, drinks, rentals extra

activities.description: Hidden gem on Grand Cayman's northern tip where you can see colorful Red Cushion sea stars in shallow water without snorkeling gear. One of the few places to observe these Caribbean starfish right in the shallows.

providers.name: Self-guided visit
providers.notes: Free parking at end of Water Cay Road, 2-3 minute walk to beach

providers.name: George's Watersports
providers.description: 4-stop stingray eco tour includes Starfish Point

providers.name: Red Sail Sports
providers.description: North Sound Eco-Safari from Camana Bay

providers.name: Rowan Watersports
providers.description: 3.5-hour small-group boat safari including Starfish Point

price_range.notes: Free entry to beach. Tours $50-100 depending on inclusions.

location.area: North Side, near Rum Point and Kaibo

rules: Keep sea stars underwater at all times
Marine police often stationed at location
tips: Mid-morning to early afternoon best for visibility
Weekdays less crowded
Avoid cruise ship days
Wear water shoes or reef-safe sandals
Use reef-safe sunscreen
Kaibo restaurant 10-minute walk away for lunch

activities.description: Peaceful horseback ride along secluded Barker's Beach with experienced trail guides. Options include beach-only rides and beach with sea swim rides where you ride bareback into the warm Caribbean waters.

providers.name: Pampered Ponies
providers.description: Founded 1996, free transfers from George Town and Seven Mile Beach

providers.name: Cayman Horse Riding (Nicki's)
providers.description: Small locally owned stable, intimate rides with photo stops and history

tips: Book in advance, especially December-April
Barkers Beach has no restrooms or restaurants
Wear lightweight quick-drying clothes
Water shoes or sneakers recommended
Apply reef-safe sunscreen and insect repellent

activities.description: View Grand Cayman's underwater world without getting wet. See fish, coral, turtles, and shipwrecks while staying dry and comfortable. Perfect for those unable or uncomfortable with diving or snorkeling.

tour_options.name: Stingray City Glass Bottom
tour_options.description: Watch reef fish through glass, slip into shallow water to interact with stingrays

location.departure: Balboa Beach Boat Dock (2-minute walk from Royal Watler cruise pier)

restrictions.mobility: Must step on/off boat without assistance

activities.description: World-class diving with 365+ diverse dive sites on Grand Cayman alone. Famous for steep drop-offs, coral pinnacles, caves, and historic wrecks in clear, calm waters. Regular encounters with sea turtles, reef sharks, eagle rays, groupers, and vibrant tropical fish.

notable_sites.name: Bloody Bay Wall
notable_sites.notes: One of deepest sea-walls in world, Jacques Cousteau top dive site

notable_sites.name: Macabuca
notable_sites.type: Shore dive with restaurant and bar

recommended_areas.beginners: Seven Mile Beach area, Eden Rock
recommended_areas.advanced: North Wall, Bloody Bay Wall (Little Cayman)

activities.description: Crystal-clear Caribbean waters with excellent visibility for snorkeling. Multiple accessible sites from shore and by boat.

popular_sites.name: Coral Gardens
popular_sites.description: Vibrant coral reef, often combined with Stingray City tours

providers: Most diving operators also offer snorkeling

activities.description: Possibly the most famous historic building on Grand Cayman, built in the 1700s by a wealthy Englishman. Now serves as a living museum where visitors can experience life as it was hundreds of years ago. Often called the birthplace of democracy in the Cayman Islands.

Located within Queen Elizabeth II Botanic Park, see the rare, endangered blue iguanas endemic to Grand Cayman. These incredible creatures were once nearly extinct but are now thriving thanks to dedicated conservation efforts.

Weaves through a protected mangrove forest on the island's east side, offering a taste of Cayman in its most natural state. One of the few remaining examples of old-growth dry forest in the Caribbean.

Explore the capital with jewel-colored wooden buildings lining the waterfront, housing duty-free stores and cool cafes. Visit the Cayman National Museum for local history. Extremely photogenic area perfect for walking.

price_range.notes: Free to walk around; museum admission separate

activities.description: Consistently rated one of the Caribbean's best beaches. Crescent-shaped shore with soft coral sand. Home to many of Grand Cayman's best resorts, casual beach bars, restaurants, playground, restrooms and showers.
One of Grand Cayman's most beautiful beaches with excellent snorkeling opportunities. More intimate than Seven Mile Beach with rocky formations and clear waters.

best_time_to_visit.weather: Warm year-round with average highs in the 80sÂ°F

transportation.shuttle_services: Many operators offer free shuttle from cruise port and Seven Mile Beach hotels
transportation.car_rental: Available; drive on left side of road
transportation.ferry: Cayman Ferries operates routes from Camana Bay

safety.notes: Cayman Islands known for being extremely safe, popular family destination

booking_tips: Book popular tours in advance, especially during peak season
Cruise ship days can make attractions crowded
Early morning tours often less crowded
Check moon cycle for bioluminescence tours
